key_channel_insights.line_content: OTAs price above EK.com in 58 % of checks, averaging a 10 % markup and recording zero undercuts for three straight periods.
Metasearch undercuts EK.com on 92 % of itineraries, yet the discount is a token 0.10 %, signalling avoidable revenue leakage with minimal customer benefit.
GDS shows higher fares on 64 % of itineraries with an 8 % premium, and EK fares are missing in 19 % of searches, limiting agency visibility.

conclusion.line_content: This report provides a high-level summary of the price discrepancies observed across different channels.  It is important to note that the data contains many nuances depending on various factors such as market conditions, booking windows, and the competitive landscape. Understanding these subtleties can be critical in optimizing pricing strategies and ensuring competitive positioning.

As part of our 'PriceEye' solution, we are developing an intuitive dashboard designed to help your airline's analysts drill down into this data. This tool will allow you to uncover and focus on critical actionable insights, enabling your team to make data-driven decisions with confidence.

We are here to support you in leveraging these insights to enhance your revenue management and distribution strategies. Please don't hesitate to connect with our team for more information about how PriceEye can assist you in achieving your business objectives.

ota_highlights.line_content: 58 % of EK itineraries are higher-priced on OTAs with a 10 % average markup.
Zero OTA-lower cases recorded across 28 observations, unchanged for three periods.
Short-haul routes see 77 % OTA-higher incidence and a 16 % premium versus just 2 % on long-haul.

ota_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Only 3.3 % of itineraries are absent from OTAs (-0.4 ppt MoM), confirming strong third-party availability.
Parity has slipped to 38 % (-0.8 ppt MoM) as more checks move into OTA-higher territory.
OTA-higher rose to 58 % (+1.2 ppt MoM) while the 10 % premium remains stable.
No instances of OTA beating EK.com prices, indicating strict upward pricing bias.

ota_summary_by_region.line_content: OTAs higher 77 % of the time with a 16 % premium; parity just 21 %.
Parity improves to 53 %, and OTA premium narrows to 2 %, yet higher cases are creeping up (+0.7 ppt WoW).

ota_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: OTAs higher on 59 % of AE departures with a 10 % uplift; parity 36 %.
Pattern mirrors domestic: 58 % OTA-higher and an 11 % premium.

ota_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: 57 % OTA-higher, 9 % premium; slight WoW improvement (-0.6 ppt).

mse_highlights.line_content: MSE cheaper than EK.com on 91.6 % of itineraries, marginally down 0.2 ppt WoW.
Average discount is just 0.10 %, meaning parity fixes carry little revenue risk.
98.6 % of long-haul checks undercut, albeit by only 0.05 %.

mse_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: 91.6 % share (-0.2 ppt WoW, ‑2.4 ppt MoM); undercut depth steady at ‑0.10 %.
Parity at 7.9 % (-2.2 ppt MoM) as more fares drift below EK.com.
Only 0.4 % of itineraries show MSE premiums averaging +0.09 %.
Not-listed cases down to 0.2 %, confirming near-complete MSE coverage.

mse_summary_by_region.line_content: 83 % cheaper on MSE with a deeper ‑0.18 % gap; parity 16 %.
Almost universal undercutting (98.6 %) but shallow ‑0.05 % delta.

mse_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: Undercutting at 98.7 % yet only ‑0.05 % cheaper; easy home-market fix.
MSE lower on 86 % with a larger ‑0.15 % discount; bigger yield upside abroad.

mse_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: 91 % MSE-lower, ‑0.11 % discount; early signs of parity recovery (-0.6 ppt WoW).
93 % MSE-lower, ‑0.09 % discount; undercut share rose 0.6 ppt WoW.

gds_highlights.line_content: 64 % of itineraries priced higher in GDS with an 8 % average premium.
EK.com fare missing in 19 % of GDS searches, up 2 ppt WoW.
GDS beats EK.com in only 0.2 % of cases.

gds_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: 64.3 % share; 8 % premium. Trend easing but still dominant.
19.2 % of searches lack EK.com fare, +1.9 ppt WoW.
Only 16.3 % parity, largely unchanged over time.
Lower prices appear in just 0.19 % of checks.

gds_summary_by_region.line_content: 60 % GDS-higher with a 16 % premium; 35 % of offers missing.
68 % GDS-higher but only 2 % premium; parity improves to 26 %.

gds_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: GDS higher 63 % of the time with a 10 % uplift; missing fares now 8 %.

gds_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: 66 % GDS premiums at 8 %; 18 % of EK fares absent.
63 % premiums with 8 % delta; missing-fare rate widens to 22 %.
